alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Dangerous Snow Squalls Likely Tonight... Snow squalls embedded in a line of heavy precipitation will move eastward into northern and western New Hampshire between 9PM and Midnight, and into northwestern Maine from 10 PM through 2AM. Expect rapidly changing conditions with heavy snowfall rates and wind gusts up to 35 mph causing very low visibilities and snow- covered roads, especially through the higher terrain. At lower elevations, precipitation may initially start as rain before changing to snow. As the snow comes to an end, temperatures quickly fall below freezing, causing any remaining water or slush on any untreated surfaces to refreeze and become slick overnight. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Be prepared for areas of blowing and drifting snow. This could lead to temporary whiteout conditions and the potential for dangerous driving conditions. Untreated surfaces will become slippery once covered with snow, and remain hazardous through the overnight hours. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and use extra caution in rapidly changing conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford
